result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian M. Ferber

records.addlTxt:
11:00AM Cases called: 21CF1361, 22CF45, 22CM25 & 22CM41 Defendant Brian M. Ferber in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Brian M. Ferber. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. Defense needs to finish plea paperwork. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
(off record briefly for paperwork completion)

11:08am RECALLED Same appearances. Defendant will enter a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CF45: Possession of Methamphetamine. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
24 months Probation sentence withheld with conditions
Conditions of Probation:
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
No verbal or aggressive behavior against anyone.
Not to enter any bars, liquor stores or taverns.
court costs

Anything else, including all of 21CF1361, 22CM25 & 22CM41, is ordered dismissed and read in as well as the ride along citations. 
Jail credit if revoked is 0 days.
Plea hearing on May 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:07 AM Cases called: 21CF1361, 22CF45, 22CM25 and 22CM41. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian M. Ferber in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Brian M. Ferber. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 21CF1361 & 22CF45 and Court accepts waiver. All 4 cases care referred to Br. 1 for scheduling. 

Defendant would like to modify a no contact on the bond that covers all 4 cases. State would like victim to contact the Victim Witness Office or have Defense file a Motion.

Conditions:
No contact with A.S. except contact allowed for purposes of transport for medical appointments and not to discuss the cases with one another.
No contact with N.C., R.W., S.W., S.S.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
(Covers 21CF1361, 22CF45, 22CM41, 22CM25)

(9:51 AM cases 21CF1361, 22CM25, 22CM41, 22CF45 called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian M. Ferber appeared in court. Attorney Roger M Hillestad for Brian M. Ferber appeared in court. 
Attorney Hillestad advises was just appointed and is requesting new dates.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on March 28, 2022 at 2:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant waives formal reading of the complaints in all cases and time limits for preliminary hearing in cases 21CF1361 and 22CF45.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on February 14, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
